subject: Western Sahara War
object: Spanish withdrawal under the Madrid Accords (1976), Mauritanian retreat and withdrawal of territorial claims and peace agreement with the Polisario Front (1979), Military Stalemate, Ceasefire agreed on between the Polisario Front and Morocco (1991)

subject: Western Sahara War
object: Morocco controls 75% of the territory, the Polisario Front controls 25%

subject: Western Sahara War
object: Morocco, Mauritania, France, Supported by Saudi Arabia and United States

subject: Commanders and leaders
object: Hassan II, Ahmed Dlimi, Abdelaziz Bennani, Mohamed Abrouk, Housni Benslimane, Hammou Arzaz

subject: Commanders and leaders
object: Mokhtar Ould Daddah, Mustafa Ould Salek, Mohamed Khouna Ould Haidallah, Maaouya Ould Sid'Ahmed Taya, Mohamed Ould Bah Ould Abdelkader

subject: Commanders and leaders
object: Valéry Giscard d'Estaing (President and Commander-in-Chief), Michel Claude Forget

subject: Commanders and leaders
object: Mohamed Abdelaziz, El-Ouali Mustapha Sayed (†), Brahim Ghali, Lahbib Ayoub, Mohamed Lamine Uld Bujari, Mohamed Ali El Admi

subject: Casualties and losses
object: More than 3,000 Sahrawis killed (Eckhardt,1985), 3 West German pilots killed, 853+ (Project Disappeared) - 1,500 (International Federation of Human Rights) Sahrawis missing, 40,000 (1976) - 80,000 (1977) Sahrawis displaced
